alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:31PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph and southeastern Delaware Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Albany, or 9 miles east of Muncie, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Randolph and southeastern Delaware Counties, including the following locations... Farmland, Prairie Creek Reservoir, Parker City and Selma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Indiana.
